root.name: str()

example.code: b = False y = -28 c = 'R' f = -32.6 i = 1024 sb = str(b) sy = str(y) sc = str(c) sf = str(f) si = str(i) sb = sb + sy + sc + sf + si print(sb) # Prints 'False-28R-32.61024'

root.description: Returns the string representation of primitive datatypes and arrays. For example the integer 3 will return the string "3", the float -12.6 will return the string "-12.6", and a Boolean value True will return the string "True".

parameter.label: var
parameter.description: any int, float, character, string, boolean
